title: Liverpool legend Kenny Dalglish tipped off Andrea Radrizzani about "sleeping giant" Leeds
text:
Sport Liverpool legend Kenny Dalglish tipped off Andrea Radrizzani about "sleeping giant" Leeds Radrizzani had lunch with Dalglish in Manchester in April when he suggested Leeds would be a great investment Share New Leeds co-owner Andrea Radrizzani (Photo: VARLEY PICTURE AGENCY) Share Get Liverpool FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
Leeds’ new co-owner Andrea Radrizzani has revealed how Kenny ­Dalglish tipped him off about the Elland Road club. 
Radrizzani had lunch with Dalglish in Manchester in April when the Liverpool legend suggested Leeds would be a great investment opportunity. 
The conversation stuck with Radrizzani and he opened talks with Massimo Cellino the following month after an ­associate also suggested buying into the Whites. 
“I was invited to a lunch in Manchester before the quarter-final of the Champions League between Manchester City and Paris Saint-Germain, and I met Kenny,” said the Italian, 42. 
“He wasn’t easy to ­understand, but I did! We talked about Leeds, the sleeping giant. He mentioned it was a great opportunity if someone had a concrete project with a vision to bring back the passion. Kenny Dalglish suggested Leeds would be a great investment (Photo: Reuters / Phil Noble) 
“He mentioned about how the city is passionate about the club, and this is what I’m finding out. Maybe he told me this because he knew that I couldn’t buy Liverpool! 
“A few weeks later, I was talking about different clubs and someone mentioned Leeds. That’s when I got in touch with Massimo.” 
Eight months later and those talks have resulted in Radrizzani buying a 50 per cent stake in Leeds with a view to purchasing full control in the summer. 
Radrizzani, who with his business partners sold sports rights firm MP and Silva for £685million in May, has a five-year plan to buy back Elland Road, modernise it and return Leeds to the Premier League. 
He will not throw cash at Leeds and their boss Garry Monk, and instead wants to grow the club by unlocking its huge potential. Garry Monk has transformed Leeds into promotion hopefuls (Photo: Laurence Griffiths) 
“My timeline is five years,” he added. “That is where I want to judge myself and see if I have done well or not enough to stay here. 
"That means having ­sustainable growth as I think the club has suffered too much.It’s been a rollercoaster, where the club has been in and out of different ownership. 
“At the moment the ­infrastructure is very old in terms of management, services and facilities. 
“I hope we go up to the Premier League this year, but if we don’t we need to be able to progress the club and be ready for when we do go up. 
“This progression requires a balance on and off the pitch. It’s not easy as I’m not here to lose money every year for the rest of my life. That would be stupid.” poll loading Will Garry Monk take Leeds back to the Premier League? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
